channel.title: Is it possible
channel.description: Is it possible to make a webclient with a bat file? My client is impossible to jar so I have to use a .bat that refers to the unusable .jar. Therefore I would need to upload both the bat and jar then have the bat load the webclient. Can anyone write that script?

item.title: Is it possible
item.dc:creator: @Akia Akia
item.description:
@Akia wrote:

No its not you need to just jar it and make it a drop box and use that. All clients are jar able!

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If your client has java files and .class files, it’s not impossible to jar.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible
item.dc:creator: @lord0ftacos lord0ftacos
item.description:
@lord0ftacos wrote:

devenb123:

Is it possible to make a webclient with a bat file? My client is impossible to jar so I have to use a .bat that refers to the unusable .jar. Therefore I would need to upload both the bat and jar then have the bat load the webclient. Can anyone write that script?

I am 99% sure this is not possible, but I may be wrong.

What do you mean by your client being unjarable? Send me a download link and I’ll see if I can do it.

Read full topic
